Datastructures.Clauses

Class ClauseList

  • java.lang.Object
    • Datastructures.Clauses.ClauseList

  • public class ClauseList
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by ohlbach on 26.08.2018. This class is for collecting sets of clauses in different groups. It supports inserting clauses, removing clauses and literals, retrieving clauses and literals. A literal index is used to access literals and clauses quickly. Removing literals and replacing them with representatives in an equivalence class can be observed by corresponding consumer functions.
    The clauses are sorted according to a comparator (default: clause length)
    The literals in the literal index are also sorted (default: clause length)

        public void addLiteralReplacementObserver(java.util.function.BiConsumer<CLiteral,java.lang.Boolean> observer)
        adds an observer which is called after a literal is replaced by another one (a representative in an equivalence class). It is called for the new CLiteral and the old literal (Integer).
        Parameters:
        observer - a consumer function to be applied to a CLiteral

      • removeClause

        public void removeClause(Clause clause)

        Parameters:

        Parameters:

        group - the clause group where the clause is

      • removeLiteral

        public void removeLiteral(CLiteral cliteral)
        removes a literal from the clause.
        All literalRemovalObservers are called.
        Parameters:
        cliteral - the literal to be removed.

      • removeLiteral

        public void removeLiteral(int literal)
        removes all clauses with the given (pure) literal
        Parameters:
        literal - a pure literal

      • makeTrue

        public void makeTrue(int literal)
        All disjunctions with the literal are removed.
        All negated literals are removed from the disjunctions.
        All literalRemovalObservers are called.
        Parameters:
        literal - a literal which is supposed to be true.

      • replaceByRepresentative

        public void replaceByRepresentative(int representative,
                                    int literal)
        replaces a literal by its representative in an equivalence class in all clauses containing the literal and its negation. If the clause then contains double literals, one of the is removed.
        If the clause becomes a tautology, it is entirely removed.
        The corresponding observers are called.
        LiteralReplacementObservers are called before the replacement (with parameter true)
        and after the replacement (with parameter false)
        Parameters:
        literal - the literal to be replaced
        representative - the new literal

      • getOccurrences

        public int getOccurrences(int literal)
        gets the number of cLiterals containing the given literal
        Parameters:
        literal - a literal
        Returns:
        the number of cLiterals containing the given literal

      • isPure

        public boolean isPure(int literal)
        checks whether there are no disjunctions with negated literals any more
        Parameters:
        literal - a literal
        Returns:
        true if there are no negated literals anymore.

      • stream

        public java.util.stream.Stream<CLiteral> stream(int literal,
                                                ImplicationDAG implicationDAG,
                                                boolean down)
        generates a stream of CLiterals which are implied by the given literal
        Parameters:
        literal - a literal
        implicationDAG - the implication DAG
        down - if true then the DAG is traversed downwards, otherwise upwards
        Returns:
        a stream of CLiterals l such that literal implies l (including the literal itself.)

      • streamContradicting

        public java.util.stream.Stream<CLiteral> streamContradicting(int literal,
                                                             ImplicationDAG implicationDAG)
        generates a stream of CLiterals which contradict the given literal
        Example: literal = p and p -> q: all CLiterals with -p and -q are returned.
        Parameters:
        literal - a literal
        implicationDAG - the implication DAG
        Returns:
        a stream of CLiterals l such that literal implies l (including the literal itself.)

        applies a consumer to all CLiterals which are implied by the given literal (including the literal itself)
        Parameters:
        literal - a literal
        implicationDAG - the ID_Implications
        down - if true then the ImplicationDAG is followed downwards, otherwise upwards.
        consumer - a function to be applied to a CLiteral
